result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara Gwen Barsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $4,718.08 payable to Discover Financial or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees while on probation or civil jugment will be entered with tax intercept.

Pursuant to 973.015 Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdmeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful  completion of the sentence. Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law within one (1) year, upon submission of motion. Expungement is not contingent upon payment of costs, fees, restitution and surcharges.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.If defendant test positive, to participate in AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatmet.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve THREE (3) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for ELEVEN (11) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* If Defendant tests POSITIVE,  Defendant to participate in AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to DISCOVER FINANCIAL for FOUR THOUSAND SEVEN HUNDRED EIGHTEEN DOLLARS AND EIGHT CENTS ($4,718.08) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees WHILE ON PROBATION or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
* Court does not have any objection to Probation being transferred to another County.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS,  FEES,  RESTITUTION OR SURCHARGES.
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
(1).  Proof of Restitution payment.  Filed, sdg.

On Motion of the State,  Court AMENDED count 1 to Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a Class A Misdemeanor CONTRARY to Wisconsin Statute(s) 943.20(1)(a).  Court ordered Judgment of Conviction as to the amended charge.
Update on AODA Compliance on DPA.  09-30-2016 and Progress note.  Filed, sdg.
(1).  Proof of Restitution.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant has picked up a new case in a different County.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ADOPTED the Motion of the State as regards the modification of the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
(from) Attorney Firer confirming TWENTY-FIVE DOLLAR ($25.00) Restitution payment.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has found a stable residence AND is re-engaged with Treatment.  Defendant provided a TWENTY-FIVE DOLLAR ($25.00) payment towards Restitution TODAY (09-13-2016).  Court went off the Record  to hold Sidebar in Chambers.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Defendant to provide further results regarding UA's.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant will need to provide RANDOM UA's.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO HAVE BETWEEN TWO (2) AND FOUR (4) UA's per MONTH.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Update on AODA Compliance on DPA.  07-21-2016 through 09-12-2016.  Filed, sdg.
Update on AODA Compliance on DPA.  07-18-2016 through 07-22-2016.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Restitution has not ben completed yet.  State will be discussing with their Office and Defense will be investigating a move from Appleton to Oshkosh for purposes of treatment.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Update on AODA Compliance on DPA.  07-04-2016 through 07-08-2016.  Filed, sdg.

Update on AODA Compliance on DPA.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense advises the court that the defendant is making big progress. State agrees with defense. State previously had entered request to revoke defendant, but due to the new progress, state moves to withdraw request. Case calendared for 7/12/2016 at 1:30 for review heaing in br. 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
(1).  Treatment notes.  Filed, sdg.
PUBLIC DEFENDER REPORT, FILED

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judy Burbach appeared on behalf of the OSPD.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  Court held staffing in Chambers with ALL Parties.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to have the Court CONTINUE to take their Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT.  Court CONTINUED to take the Motion to Revoke under ADVISEMENT.  Defense advised that Defendant will be in an in-patient facility out of Milwaukee County.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court advised the Defendant of the consequences if the DPA is revoked.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record matter was staffed with all Counsel and Judy Burbach of the OSPD.  Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that Defendant self-discharged from the facility in Hales Corners and returned to Oshkosh.  JusticePoint is unable to monitor the Defendant in a different County.  Given the non-compliance of the Defendant,  State moved to REVOKE the agreement.  Defense objected and advised that he will speak with the DDA to ask for an alternative disposition in this case.  Defense advised that Defendant has been testing NEGATIVE recently.  Defense will contact Defendant's parents to arrange residence with her mother.  Defense requested that the Court take the State's Motion to REVOKE under advisement at this time.  COURT TAKES THAT REQUEST UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  COURT TURNED OVER DEFENDANT TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $500.00 PR BOND.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court commended Defendant for compliance with the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
(3).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter in Court to address JusticePoint Violation.

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  Court held staffing in Chambers with JusticePoint case manager Melissa Drews and Judy Burbach from the OSPD.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.

Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant expressed that she would be willing to enter in-patient treatment.  Court advised the Defendant that the State is considering revocation.  COURT TAKES DEFENDANT INTO CUSTODY, TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT.  UPON RELEASE TO JUSTICEPOINT,  BAIL TO REVERT TO $500.00 PR BOND.  All other terms of the PR Bond are to remain in full force and effect.  Matter remains calendared for Review 01-19-2016 at 10:00am

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court reviewed the proferred documents.  Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense reports that American Behavioral Clinic (ABC) requires co-pay,  and that Defendant does not always have the required amount.  Currently Defendant will be returning to the ABC until another treatment facility can be found.  State is concerned about attendance at group meetings.  Defense requests a THIRTY (30) DAY adjournment.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
From Megan Ludwikowski, SAC to Judy Burbach.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps and Judy Burbach from the Office of the State Public Defender.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has progressed and is in compliance with the agreement.  Ms. Burback reports that Defendant very nearly completed the IOP.  Defendant will be attending AODA at American Health between two and three times per week.  Ms. Burback will be following through with the Counselor's at American Health to ensure proper treatment is received by the Defendant.  State does not oppose a brief adjournment for treatment.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court not in session 9-14-2015.  Review hearing scheduled for 9-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Atty Epps notified by phone.

Defendant Sara Gwen Barsch in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.    The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

Case adjourned to 09-14-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 33, Judge Ashley's Court for Review Hearing.
